title: New BCCI President-Elect Sourav Ganguly Wants Virat Kohli To Focus On Winning Big Trophies
text:
The new BCCI president-elect Sourav Ganguly wants the Indian team management to focus on winning big trophies, and is one specific area he wants Virat Kohli to address.

Facebook

"My only thing is that they need to win big tournaments. The are not going to win every time but they have gone through seven tournaments without winning one," Ganguly told reporters at the Eden Gardens on his arrival to the city from Mumbai.

"They are a much better side than that. That is an area they need to get ready mentally. Talent is enormous. We reached the World Cup semis. That's an issue which Virat needs to address. It doesn't happen in the boardroom," said the 47-year-old.

It has been six years since India last won a major ICC event - it came in England when the MS Dhoni led team won the ICC Champions Trophy, beating the hosts in a nail-biter. Since India have failed to win any big tournament.

After losing the 2016 T20 World Cup semifinal to eventual winners West Indies, India again suffered heartache in the 2017 Champions Trophy final after losing to arch-rivals Pakistan. It was to be followed by the semifinal loss to New Zealand in this year's 50-over World Cup.

Now Sourav Ganguly who will soon take charge of the BCCI, wants to team to focus on winning big tournaments.

Virat Kohli and team will get their chance in next year's T20 World Cup which takes place in October-November in Australia.

(With Inputs From IANS)
